message.content: This question requires knowledge about the behavior of light when it interacts with different surfaces. Refraction occurs when light passes through a medium with a different refractive index. In this case, when light shines at a gem, it enters the gem and changes direction due to the change in refractive index. Options (B) and (C) refer to reflection, not refraction. Option (D) also refers to reflection, as light bounces off the surface of the car.

This question requires knowledge about the properties of light and how it interacts with different objects. Refraction occurs when light passes through a medium with a different refractive index and changes direction. Option (A) is correct because when light shines at a gem, it will be refracted as it passes through the gem due to the difference in refractive indices between air and the gem. Option (B) is incorrect because when light shines at a mirror, it undergoes reflection, not refraction. Option (C) is incorrect because when light reflects off a spoon, it undergoes reflection, not refraction. Option (D) is incorrect because when light reflects off a car, it undergoes reflection, not refraction.

This question requires knowledge about the phenomenon of refraction. Refraction occurs when light passes through a medium with a different optical density, causing it to change direction. In this case, when light shines at a gem, it enters the gem and is refracted as it passes through the different layers of the gem. Options (B), (C), and (D) refer to reflection, not refraction.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the phenomenon of refraction. Refraction is the bending of light as it passes through different mediums. In this case, when light shines at a gem, it enters the gem and changes direction due to the change in speed and density of the medium. Option (B) is incorrect because mirrors reflect light, they do not refract it. Option (C) is incorrect because when light reflects off a spoon, it does not change direction, it simply bounces off. Option (D) is incorrect for the same reason as option (C), when light reflects off a car, it does not change direction.
